benchmark_details.name: ResponseNet
benchmark_details.overview: ResponseNet is a new dataset comprising 696 high-quality dyadic interactions featuring synchronized split-screen videos, multichannel audio, transcripts, and facial behavior annotations. It supports the Online Multimodal Conversational Response Generation (OMCRG) task by providing multimodal data suitable for generating synchronized verbal and non-verbal listener responses.
benchmark_details.data_type: synchronized split-screen videos, multichannel audio, transcripts, facial behavior annotations

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To establish a standardized evaluation for the Online Multimodal Conversational Response Generation (OMCRG) task.

data.source: Automated sourcing from YouTube and manual curation for quality assurance.
data.format: synchronized video files, transcriptions in text format
data.annotation: Manual annotation by experts for facial behavior and speech transcriptions.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on comparisons between generated outputs and reference responses.
methodology.interpretation: Performance interpreted based on scores, with higher values indicating better generation quality and synchronization.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparative results against several established baselines are provided in the paper.
methodology.validation: Extensive evaluations against baseline models to ensure accuracy and consistency of the dataset.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Privacy measures are in place due to the collection of multimodal data involving human participants.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: CC BY-NC-SA license for non-commercial use with attribution required.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Informed consent obtained from participants involved in data collection.
